Mail-Related Definitions

Here you can find declarations for various structures used in mail-related tasks throughout the system. More...


Modules

group  Message Flags (MSF_x)
 Flags used to describe private and public messages.

group  User Mail Preference Flags (ECP_x)
 Flags used to describe user preferences as regards private email reading.

group  Mail Flags (ECF_x)
 Flags used to store user state with respect to mail reading.

group  Last-Read Block Flags (LRF_x)
 Flags used to store state with respect to public mail reading.

group  Club Flags (CLF_x)
 Flags used to describe clubs in the club header.

group  Club Access Levels (CAX_x)
 These constants denote the various club access levels.

 Preferences for the private mail reader. More...

struct  lastread
 Per-user, per-club message reading state. More...

 Club header. More...

Detailed Description

Here you can find declarations for various structures used in mail-related tasks throughout the system.

The most useful is the definition of message_t, a BBS private or public message. There are other structures here, but most are used by the mail reading modules (Email and Clubs). I doubt you'll ever need any of them, but a few subsystems do, so the declarations are available.

#define MESSAGE_MAGIC   "Mmsg"
 

Definition at line 230 of file mail.h.

#define MSG_ALL   "***ALL***"
 

Used to mark a message as intended for all users.

Do not change after you start using your system. This string does not appear to the user. Instead, a nice, user-defined version is shown. See? You really, really don't have to change this.
